text: MCP tools: `memory_context(query)` retrieves ranked context; `memory_add_bullet(node_slug, text, bullet_type)` adds a bullet; `memory_show(slug)` dumps a node. Session ID auto-injected by the hook.
CLI: `kg context "query"` for context output; `kg search "query"` for raw FTS results; `kg show <slug>` to inspect a node and clear its review flag.
Prefer `memory_context` over `memory_search` for LLM consumption — it packs results into a token-budgeted block with explore hints already formatted.
Cross-reference nodes with [[slug]] in bullet text. The indexer extracts these as backlinks and context output surfaces them as "Explore:" hints.
Fleeting notes: `memory_add_bullet(node_slug="_fleeting-<session_id[:12]>", text="discovered: X")` — node auto-creates on first write. Use for in-session captures.

Viewing a node does NOT clear its review budget. `memory_show` / `kg show` are read-only. Only `memory_mark_reviewed(slug)` / `kg review <slug>` clears the budget — use after actually doing the maintenance work.

Review workflow: `memory_review()` → lists hot nodes → `memory_show(slug)` to inspect → update/prune/push info to other nodes → `memory_mark_reviewed(slug)` to clear. Skipping the last step means the node stays flagged.
File sources indexed via `[[sources]]` in kg.toml appear in `kg context` output alongside curated nodes — same FTS index, no distinction needed.

kg create <slug> <title> [--type]: creates node with explicit title. Idempotent — exits 0 if already exists. Use when kg add's auto-create (which defaults title=slug) isn't sufficient, e.g. daily note nodes.
kg review shows aggregate Votes column (+u/-h) per node. Bullets where harmful > useful are flagged ⚠ in the Flagged column.
/note and /notes skills in .kg/skills/ (accessible via .claude symlink). /note adds [HH:MM]-stamped bullet to notes-YYYY-MM-DD with async background cross-ref enrichment via kg search + kg context.
kg status: Embeddings row under Vectors shows configured model; red warning + fix hint if Gemini model selected but no API key found

kg agents quick-start: (1) add [agents] enabled=true to kg.toml, (2) kg mux start -d, (3) kg agent create <name>, (4) kg launcher start -d for auto-management, (5) kg run <name> for interactive session OR send messages from web UI at /agents. [[kg-agent-mux]] [[kg-agent-launcher]]
